page.title: 05Public Transport
page.content: There is a bus service from Bellingham to Kielder but very few buses. People without cars are worried that this service may disappear altogether as very few use it, most families have cars. The water supply for Greenhaugh and Lanehead comes from Catcleugh. The mains pipe continues up the north side of the river. On the south side and in more remote parts people rely on springs which sometimes dry up in summer. A mobile library travels the area visiting the villages fortnightly & more remote parts monthly. Children are able to borrow books from school where there is a large selection from the County Library which is changed each term. There is a library in Bellingham. The NE Electricity Board supplies all but the most remote cottages. These use calor gas, coal, wood and oil for fuel.
